intro: Cusparia candolleana, commonly known as the Candolleana spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with yellowish-green petals. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may be invasive in some regions.
